course_description: Learn the fundamentals of Python programming, including syntax, data types, control structures, and functions, through hands-on practice and real-world examples.
course_overview: This beginner-level course provides a solid foundation in Python programming. Topics include variables, loops, conditionals, functions, error handling, and basic data structures. Students will complete coding exercises and small projects to apply concepts and develop problem-solving skills.
target_audience: Individuals with no prior programming experience or those seeking to transition into Python as their first language.
learning_outcomes: Write and execute simple Python scripts
Apply variables and data types to store and manipulate information
Debug common syntax and logic errors in code
Design programs using control structures (loops, conditionals)
Explain core programming concepts through practical examples
Utilize built-in functions and create custom functions
Develop small applications to solve basic computational problems
